title: 106_s606
content: SECTION 1. SATISFACTION OF CLAIMS AGAINST THE UNITED STATES. The Secretary of the Treasury shall pay $9,500,000 to Global Exploration and Development Corporation, $10,000,000 to Kerr-McGee Corporation, and $0 to Kerr-McGee Chemical, LLC. The payments are in settlement of all claims as recommended by the United States Court of Federal Claims. Payment authorized by subsections (a)(2) and (a)(3) in settlement of claims of Kerr-McGee Corporation and Kerr-McGee Chemical, LLC as recommended by the United States Court of Federal Claims. Limitation on fees not to exceed 15% of sums authorized. Criminal prohibition on distribution of certain information related to explosives, destructive devices, and weapons of mass destruction. Criminal prohibition on teaching or demonstrating the making or use of explosives, destructive devices, or weapons of mass destruction, with penalties for distributing related information. The text prohibits teaching or demonstrating the making or use of explosives, destructive devices, or weapons of mass destruction, with penalties for distributing related information. SEC. 3. SETTLEMENT OF CLAIMS OF MENOMINEE INDIAN TRIBE OF WISCONSIN. The Secretary of the Treasury will pay $32,052,547 to the Menominee Indian Tribe of Wisconsin for damages incurred due to a specific Act. The Menominee Indian Tribe of Wisconsin will receive a payment in full satisfaction of any claims against the United States for damages incurred before April 30, 1961. This payment will have the status of a judgment of the United States Court. The Menominee Indian Tribe of Wisconsin will receive a payment in full satisfaction of any claims against the United States for damages incurred before April 30, 1961. The payment will be treated as a judgment of the United States Court of Federal Claims for the Indian Tribal Judgment Funds Use or Distribution Act. The distribution of the payment must meet certain requirements, including a minimum of 30 percent distributed on a per capita basis and the remainder allocated for tribal needs such as educational, economic development, and health care programs. Additionally, no more than 15 percent of the total sum authorized for payment shall be allocated for attorney fees and litigation expenses. Any agent or attorney authorized to be paid for services in connection with the recovery of sums shall not receive more than $1,000 as a fine for violating this rule. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
